extendedInfo.description: Every year Melbourne Queer Film Festival (MQFF) brings movie lovers together for the largest film festival of its kind in Australia. For 10 glorious days the Festival will delight you with the best on international GLBTIQ cinema and homegrown talent by screening over 150 films including features, documentaries, animations and shorts. Explore the program: - Browse the program by name, date, venue, director, country and language - Browse âWhatâs Onâ at the festival daily - Check if sessions are Selling Fast or Sold Out - try not to miss out! - Read event information and watch film trailers - Find your way around Melbourne with maps for Venues and Amenities Buy and download tickets: - Buy tickets securely with your credit card: anywhere, anytime - Buy passes and redeem films immediately - Go paperless: download tickets to be scanned at the cinema door - Add your films to iCal Schedule your attendance and share with friends: - Create a shortlist of events through Wishlist - Share events through email, Twitter and Facebook - Share your ticketed sessions with friends through email or add them to iCal - Follow the festival Facebook and Twitter feeds - Want to be part of the conversation? Include @mqff2013 or #mqff2013 in your tweets.ABOUT THE DEVELOPERS: Ferve Tickets (previously eFirst) has been working with festivals in Australia for the last decade, setting up customized ticketing systems to deliver a smooth, stress-free festival experience â for both staff and customers. ABOUT MELBOURNE QUEER FILM FESTIVAL: The Festival attracts broad and diverse audiences by exhibiting high quality films that appeal to the GLBTIQ community and film buffs at large. MQFF not only screens award-winning international films but also showcases the best emerging talents of homegrown queer cinema with it's âOz Docsâ, âCelluloid Casseroleâ and âOz Shortsâ programs.MQFF is an iconic event of the Melbourne cultural calendar, enjoyed by audiences of over 25,000 patrons annually. SPONSORS: MQFF is brought to you each year with the generous assistance of our partners. Please support them in return.The Festival offers cost effective multi-platform advertising opportunities for your company to reach our fashion forward, educated, high-income earning, brand savvy consumers across print, online and in cinema. To find out more please email manager@mqff.com.au. Principle Partner: City of Melbourne Cultural Partner: ACMI Major Partners: FIAT, Crown Metropol MelbourneMedia Partners: Time Out Melbourne, Star Observer, JOY 94.9, SameSame.com.auAnd many moreâ¦
